Vintage Social Media

Subject to change as the Spring: 2018 term progresses. ★ marks the required reading.

Lecture Topic Readings
January 11, 2018 Introduction
  • Introduction of social media and natural language processing research
  • Overview of the course
  • Quiz 1 (due Jan 18 - hand in paper copy at the beginning of class)
  • ★ Diurnal and Seasonal Mood Vary with Work, Sleep, and Daylength Across Diverse Cultures by Golder and Macy (Science 2011)
  • Psychological Language on Twitter Predicts County-Level Heart Disease Mortality by Eichstaedt et al. (Psychological Science 2015)
  • Google's Python class by Nick Parlante
  • Intro to NLP in Python by Bird, Klein, Loper
January 18, 2018 Twitter and Twitter API Tutorial [Quiz1 due]
  • Brief history of Twitter
  • Key features of Twitter
  • Hands-on instructions on obtaining Twitter data via APIs
  • ★ Twitter API Tutorial by Wei Xu
  • ★ What is Twitter, a Social Network or a News Media? by Kwak, Lee, Park and Moon (WWW 2010)
  • How to Do Research with a Professor by Jason Eisner
  • How to Do Research by William Wang
  • How to Read a Technical Paper by Jason Eisner
January 25, 2018 Language Identification and Naïve Bayes [Reading 1 due]
  • Domain/Genre Difference
  • Language Identification
  • Supervised Learning and Classification
  • Naïve Bayes Algorithm + feature selection (Information Gain)
  • ★ Cross-domain Feature Selection for Language Identification by Lui, Baldwin (IJCNLP 2011)
  • Evaluating language identification performance by Mitja T @tm
  • langid.py: An Off-the-shelf Language Identification Tool by Lui, Baldwin (ACL 2012)
  • ★ A Dataset and Classifier for Recognizing Social Media English by Blodgett, Wei, O'Connor (W-NUT 2017)
  • 6 Easy Steps to Learn Naïve Bayes Algorithm by Sunil Ray
  • Text Classification using Naive Bayes by Hiroshi Shimodaira
February 1, 2018 Tokenization, Normalization, POS/NE Tagging for Twitter [Homework 1 due, Reading 2 due]
  • Tokenization, Emoticons
  • Noisy Text Normalization
  • What to Do about Bad Language on the Internet? by Jacob Eisenstein (NAACL 2013)
  • ★ How Noisy Social Media Text, How Diffrnt Social Media Sources? by Baldwin, Cook, Lui, MacKinlay, Wang (IJCNLP 2013)
  • Lexical Normalisation of Short Text Messages : Makn Sens a #twitter by Bo Han and Tim Baldwin (ACL 2011)
February 8, 2018 POS/NE Tagging for Twitter [No Summary Due]
  • Part-of-speech tagging
  • Named entity recognition
  • Named Entity Recognition in Tweets : An Experimental Study by Ritter, Clark, Mausam, Etzioni (EMNLP 2011)
  • Shared Tasks of the 2015 Workshop on Noisy User-generated Text : Twitter Lexical Normalization and Named Entity Recognition by Timothy Baldwin, Marie-Catherine de Marneffe, Bo Han, Young-Bum Kim, Alan Ritter, Wei Xu (WNUT 2015)
  • Bidirectional LSTM for Named Entity Recognition in Twitter Messages by Nut Limsopatham and Nigel Collier (WNUT 2016)
February 15, 2018 Paraphrase Data Sources [Read3 due]
  • Overview of paraphrase research
  • WordNet, DIRT, MRPC (Microsoft Research Paraphrase Corpus), PPDB (Paraphrase Database), etc.
  • Support Vector Machines for Paraphrase Identification and Corpus Construction by Chris Brockett and Bill Dolan (IWP 2005)
  • Paraphrasing for Style by Wei Xu, Alan Ritter, Bill Dolan, Ralph Grishman, Colin Cherry (COLING 2012)
  • ★ PPDB: The Paraphrase Database by Juri Ganitkevitch, Benjamin Van Durme, Chris Callison-Burch (NAACL 2014)
  • Paraphrasing Revisited with Neural Machine Translation by Jonathan Mallinson, Rico Sennrich, Mirella Lapata (EACL 2017)
February 22, 2018 Paraphrase Identification and Linear Regression [No Summary Due]
  • Linear Regression
  • Cost Function
  • Gradient Descent
  • SemEval-2015 Task 1: Paraphrase and Semantic Similarity in Twitter by Wei Xu, Chris Callison-Burch, William B. Dolan (SemEval 2015)
  • ★ Lecture Note on Supervised Learning by Andrew Ng
March 1, 2018 Paraphrase Identification and Logisitc Regression [No Summary Due]
  • Logistic Regression
  • Decision Boundary
  • Softmax Regression Tutorial by Ng et al.
  • ★ Pairwise Word Interaction Modeling with Deep Neural Networks for Semantic Similarity Measurement by Hua He and Jimmy Lin (NAACL 2016)
  • Extracting Lexically Divergent Paraphrases from Twitter by Wei Xu, Alan Ritter, Chris Callison-Burch, William B. Dolan, Yangfeng Ji (TACL 2014)
March 8, 2017 Vector Semantics [Read4 due]
  • Unsupervised Learning
  • Class-based Clustering: Brown Clusters
  • Soft Clustering: Singular Value Decomposition (SVD)
  • Neural Word Embeddings: Word2vec (CBOW and Skip-gram)
  • ★ Speech and Language Processing (Chapter 15 Vector Semantics) by Dan Jurafsky and James H. Martin
  • ★ Speech and Language Processing (Chapter 16 Semantics with Dense Vectors) by Dan Jurafsky and James H. Martin
  • ★ The Unreasonable Effectiveness of Word Representations for Twitter Named Entity Recognition by Cherry and Guo (NAACL 2015)
  • Neural Word Embedding as Implicit Matrix Factorization by Levy and Goldberg (NIPS 2014)
March 29, 2018 Predicting Things from Text
  • ★ "i have a feeling trump will win..................": Forecasting Winners and Losers from User Predictions on Twitter by Sandesh Swamy, Alan Ritter and Marie-Catherine de Marneffe (EMNLP 2017)
  • Linguistic Harbingers of Betrayal&colon A Case Study on an Online Strategy Game by Vlad Niculae, Srijan Kumar, Jordan Boyd-Graber, Cristian Danescu-Niculescu-Mizil (ACL 2015)
  • Success with Style: Using Writing Style to Predict the Success of Novels by Vikas Ganjigunte Ashok, Song Feng, Yejin Choi (EMNLP 2013)
  • From Tweets to Polls: Linking Text Sentiment to Public Opinion Time Series by Brendan O’Connor, Ramnath Balasubramanyan, Bryan R. Routledge, Noah A. Smith (ICWSM 2010)
April 5, 2018 Discovering User Attribute Stylistic Differences via Paraphrasing (Guest Lecture by Wei Xu) [Read5 due]
  • ★ Discovering User Attribute Stylistic Differences via Paraphrasing by Daniel Preoţiuc-Pietro, Wei Xu, Lyle Ungar (AAAI 2016)
  • Paraphrasing for Style by Wei Xu, Alan Ritter, Bill Dolan, Ralph Grishman, Colin Cherry (COLING 2012)
  • Discovering Stylistic Variations in Distributional Vector Space Models via Lexical Paraphrases by Xing Niu, Marine Carpuat (Workshop on Stylistic Variation at EMNLP 2017)
  • Shakespearizing Modern Language Using Copy-Enriched Sequence-to-Sequence Models (Workshop on Stylistic Variation at EMNLP 2017) by Harsh Jhamtani, Varun Gangal, Eduard Hovy, Eric Nyberg
April 12, 2018 Deep Learning for NLP
  • Neural Network Basicsg: Neuron, Activation Function, Non-linearity, Learning
  • Recurrent Neural Network
  • Long Short-Term Memory Networks
  • Neural Machine Translation
  • Neural Conversation Generation
  • Understanding LSTM Networks by Christopher Olah
  • ★ Sequence to Sequence Learning with Neural Networks by Ilya Sutskever, Oriol Vinyals, and Quoc Le
  • Deep Learning Tutorial by Ng et al.
  • Neural Machine Translation and Sequence-to-Sequence Models: A Tutorial by Graham Neubig
  • Adversarial Learning for Neural Dialogue Generation by Li et al.
April 19, 2018 Sentiment Analysis, Convolutional Neural Networks and Attention [Read6 due]
  • Sentiment Analysis
  • Attention Model
  • Convolutional Neural Networks
  • ★ Overcoming Language Variation in Sentiment Analysis with Social Attention by Yi Yang and Jacob Eisenstein (TACL 2017)
  • Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification by Yoon Kim (EMNLP 2014)
  • Neural Network Methods for Natural Language Processing (Book) by Yoav Goldberg (2017)
